com.ibm.team.process.common
Interface IIterationState

public interface IIterationState

Represents the initial state of an iteration as defined by a process definition. When a project area is initialized from a process definition, the process framework instantiates development lines and iterations which correspond to the state specified in the definition.

Since:
0.6

Method Summary
 IIterationState[] getChildIterations()
          Returns the iterations into which this iteration is divided.
 IDevelopmentLineState getDevelopmentLine()
          Returns the development line containing this iteration if it is a root iteration or null otherwise.
 java.lang.String getEndDateData()
          Returns the string describing the end date of the iteration.
 java.lang.String getId()
          Returns the id of the iteration this state is associated with.
 java.lang.String getIterationName()
          Returns the name of the iteration.
 java.lang.String getIterationTypeId()
          Returns the id of the iteration's type.
 IIterationState getParentIteration()
          Returns the parent iteration of this iteration or null if this iteration does not have a parent (it is rooted at a development line).
 java.lang.String getStartDateData()
          Returns the string describing the start date of the iteration.
 boolean hasDeliverable()
          Returns whether this iteration is flagged as producing planned deliverables.
 boolean isCurrent()
          Returns whether this iteration is flagged as the current iteration.
 

Method Detail

getStartDateData

java.lang.String getStartDateData()
Returns the string describing the start date of the iteration. The string should be parsed with DateFormat.

Returns:
the description of the start date

getEndDateData

java.lang.String getEndDateData()
Returns the string describing the end date of the iteration. The string should be parsed with DateFormat.

Returns:
the description of the end date

getId

java.lang.String getId()
Returns the id of the iteration this state is associated with.

Returns:
the id of the associated iteration

getIterationName

java.lang.String getIterationName()
Returns the name of the iteration.

Returns:
the iteration name

getIterationTypeId

java.lang.String getIterationTypeId()
Returns the id of the iteration's type.

Returns:
the id of the iteration's type

getChildIterations

IIterationState[] getChildIterations()
Returns the iterations into which this iteration is divided. Returns an empty array if this iteration is undivided.

Returns:
the child iterations or an empty array

getParentIteration

IIterationState getParentIteration()
Returns the parent iteration of this iteration or null if this iteration does not have a parent (it is rooted at a development line). When this method returns null, getDevelopmentLine() will return non-null and vice-versa.

Returns:
the parent interval or null

getDevelopmentLine

IDevelopmentLineState getDevelopmentLine()
Returns the development line containing this iteration if it is a root iteration or null otherwise. When this method returns null, getParentIteration() will return non-null and vice-versa.

Returns:
the parent iteration or null

isCurrent

boolean isCurrent()
Returns whether this iteration is flagged as the current iteration.

Returns:
whether this iteration is flagged as current

hasDeliverable

boolean hasDeliverable()
Returns whether this iteration is flagged as producing planned deliverables.

Returns:
whether this iteration is flagged as producing planned deliverables
